channel.title: Webclient question
channel.description: where would I find/how would I make the cache in the client folder? thanks :)

item.title: Webclient question
item.dc:creator: @mage_pwns mage pwns
item.description:
@mage_pwns wrote:

hmm, it’s not working :S i know the link works for the cache because if i type the link into the internet i get the offer to download the cache, i followed a tut on making the webclient, but it doesn’t explain on which bits to upload to the site, and where to upload them, can any1 send me in the right direction please :S i’ve only ever worked with downloadable clients :s

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient question
item.dc:creator: @Demon6994 Demon6994
item.description:
@Demon6994 wrote:

It’s actually quite easy.

All you need is a site to download the cache… Such as http://dropbox.com/ or http://fileden.com/ I don’t think fileden works, because I tried using it before.

Upload the cache to dropbox, it’s downloaded to your pc, so it’s simple drag and drop, then right click the cache and go to the add on ‘dropbox’ and get the public link. Then bam.

Use that to download your cache.

Compile the URL to your client, then use ‘JARmaker’ to make your client a .jar then you shouldn’t have any trouble finding a tut that provides the HTML you need for a website. From like 000webhost.com or even webs.com

[code]






	</applet>
[/code]

In the coding were it says client.jar you need to make sure your .jar is CLIENT.JAR not like USERNAME.jar or whatever it is. If you want a different name, then you have to change the code from client.jar to something else.

But I think i’ve explained enough…
Just look for tuts to get anything you need.

Read full topic
